column1: Facebook Catalog Product Feed Links
column2: Facebook Catalog Product Feed Links

column1: Click "Generate Product Feed" button below. After the process is done every store you have in Magento will have one product feed. You can change product feed file name on store scope level. See tooltip for more information.
column2: Click "Generate Product Feed" button below. After the process is done every store you have in Magento will have one product feed. You can change product feed file name on store scope level. See tooltip for more information.

column1: You can change product feed file name on store scope level. The option is called "Product Feed File Name" you can set it to whatever you want as long as it is unique. Two or multiple stores must not have the same file name.
column2: You can change product feed file name on store scope level. The option is called "Product Feed File Name" you can set it to whatever you want as long as it is unique. Two or multiple stores must not have the same file name.

column2: Enables or disables product feed.

column1: Product Feed File Name

column1: Your product feed file name (without extension). The file name must be unique.
column2: Your product feed file name (without extension). The file name must be unique.

column1:
The file name must be unique. Two or multiple stores must not have the same file name.
Example: If you type "yourfeed" in this field your product feed will be located at http://www.example.com/media/yourfeed.csv
column2:
The file name must be unique. Two or multiple stores must not have the same file name.

column2: See tooltip for more information.

column1:
CSV (Comma-separated values) extension .csv
TSV (Tab-separated values) extension .tsv
XML-RSS (Really Simple Syndication) extension .xml
column2:
CSV (Comma-separated values) extension .csv
TSV (Tab-separated values) extension .tsv
XML-RSS (Really Simple Syndication) extension .xml

column1: Allow Products That Are Not Visible Individually
column2: Allow Products That Are Not Visible Individually

column1: If you want to allow products that are not visible individually in product feed set this option to "Yes".
column2: If you want to allow products that are not visible individually in product feed set this option to "Yes".

column1: Some products in Magento are not visible individually, instead, they are part of other products. Examples of this are bundle products, configurable products, and grouped products. For example, the configurable product looks like a single product with drop-down lists of options for each variation. Each option is actually a separate simple product with a unique SKU, which makes it possible to track inventory for each product variation. So if you want to have these simple products inside your product feed enable this option. Same or similar applies to bundle and grouped products.
column2: Some products in Magento are not visible individually, instead, they are part of other products. Examples of this are bundle products, configurable products, and grouped products. For example, the configurable product looks like a single product with drop-down lists of options for each variation. Each option is actually a separate simple product with a unique SKU, which makes it possible to track inventory for each product variation. So if you want to have these simple products inside your product feed enable this option. Same or similar applies to bundle and grouped products.

column1: For id Use

column1: WARNING! This option should be set to sku. Please read a tooltip.
column2: WARNING! This option should be set to sku. Please read a tooltip.

column1: Magento sku product attribute is the perfect match for Facebook feed id field. You should not change this option. If for some reason you want to change it you can. Just make sure all of your products have this attribute, all of your products have non-empty value for this attribute, and attribute values are unique.
column2: Magento sku product attribute is the perfect match for Facebook feed id field. You should not change this option. If for some reason you want to change it you can. Just make sure all of your products have this attribute, all of your products have non-empty value for this attribute, and attribute values are unique.

column1: For availability Use
column2: For availability Use

column1: WARNING! This option should be empty. Please read a tooltip.
column2: WARNING! This option should be empty. Please read a tooltip.

column1: In the Magento system availability of a product is determined by complex logic and depends on multiple factors. Our extension will provide your feed with this information and format it properly. If for some reason you want to use custom product attribute for feed availability field you can. Make sure all of your products have this attribute and all of your products have non-empty value for this attribute.
column2: In the Magento system availability of a product is determined by complex logic and depends on multiple factors. Our extension will provide your feed with this information and format it properly. If for some reason you want to use custom product attribute for feed availability field you can. Make sure all of your products have this attribute and all of your products have non-empty value for this attribute.

column1: availability Map
column2: availability Map

column1: Match your availability values to Facebook defined ones: in stock, out of stock, preorder, available for order, and discontinued. Order is significant.
column2: Match your availability values to Facebook defined ones: in stock, out of stock, preorder, available for order, and discontinued. Order is significant.

column1: Facebook specification only allows following values: in stock, out of stock, preorder, available for order, and discontinued. If your store is using other language than English or you use different text for your availability values you need to map your availability values. WARNING! You need to map all Facebook values even if you are not using them.
column2: Facebook specification only allows following values: in stock, out of stock, preorder, available for order, and discontinued. If your store is using other language than English or you use different text for your availability values you need to map your availability values. WARNING! You need to map all Facebook values even if you are not using them.

column2: Type Magento product attribute code you want to use for product feed condition field.

column1:

Make sure all of your products have this attribute and all of your products have non-empty value for this attribute.
column2:
Example: condition
Make sure all of your products have this attribute and all of your products have non-empty value for this attribute.

column2: condition Map

column1: Match your condition values to Facebook defined ones: new, refurbished, and used. Order is significant.
column2: Match your condition values to Facebook defined ones: new, refurbished, and used. Order is significant.

column1: For description Use
column2: For description Use

column1: Type Magento product attribute code you want to use for product feed description field.
column2: Type Magento product attribute code you want to use for product feed description field.

column1:
Example: meta_description
Be aware that in product feed description field is required so if particular Magento attribute you selected is empty automatic alternative will be assigned with following priority:
Meta Description > Short Description > Description > Product Name.
column2:
Example: meta_description
Be aware that in product feed description field is required so if particular Magento attribute you selected is empty automatic alternative will be assigned with following priority:

column1: For gtin Use
column2: For gtin Use

column1: Type Magento product attribute code you want to use for product feed gtin field.
column2: Type Magento product attribute code you want to use for product feed gtin field.

column1:
Example: upc
Global Trade Item Number (GTIN) can include UPC, EAN, JAN, and ISBN. Make sure all of your products have this attribute and all of your products have non-empty value for this attribute. Either gtin, mpn, or brand required.
column2:
Example: upc
Global Trade Item Number (GTIN) can include UPC, EAN, JAN, and ISBN. Make sure all of your products have this attribute and all of your products have non-empty value for this attribute. Either gtin, mpn, or brand required.

column1: For mpn Use
column2: For mpn Use

column2: Type Magento product attribute code you want to use for product feed mpn field.

column1:
Example: mpn
MPN (Manufacturer Part Number)
Make sure all of your products have this attribute and all of your products have non-empty value for this attribute. Either gtin, mpn, or brand required.
column2:
Example: mpn
MPN (Manufacturer Part Number)
Make sure all of your products have this attribute and all of your products have non-empty value for this attribute. Either gtin, mpn, or brand required.

column1: For brand Use
column2: For brand Use

column1: Type Magento product attribute code you want to use for product feed brand field.
column2: Type Magento product attribute code you want to use for product feed brand field.

column1:
Example: brand
Make sure all of your products have this attribute and all of your products have non-empty value for this attribute. If some of your products do not have this attribute or have an empty value for it, below "Default Brand" will be used as an alternative. Either gtin, mpn, or brand required.
column2:
Example: brand
Make sure all of your products have this attribute and all of your products have non-empty value for this attribute. If some of your products do not have this attribute or have an empty value for it, below "Default Brand" will be used as an alternative. Either gtin, mpn, or brand required.

column1: Default brand
column2: Default brand

column1: Default brand text.
column2: Default brand text.

column1:
Brand field is required in product feed so priority for retrieving brand is:
1. Product brand attribute
2. Default brand (this field).
3. Store Name
4. Domain Name
column2:
Brand field is required in product feed so priority for retrieving brand is:
1. Product brand attribute

column1: Enables or disables additional_image_link field in product feed and sets the limit.
column2: Enables or disables additional_image_link field in product feed and sets the limit.

column1:
Empty or 0 (zero) means disabled.
Any number from 1 to 10 means enabled. The number represents a limit for additional images.
column2:
Empty or 0 (zero) means disabled.
Any number from 1 to 10 means enabled. The number represents a limit for additional images.

column1: Enable sale_price Field
column2: Enable sale_price Field

column1: Enables or disables sale_price field in product feed.
column2: Enables or disables sale_price field in product feed.

column1:
If this option is enabled, feed "price" field will be mapped to Magento "regular_price" and feed "sale_price" field will be mapped to Magento "special_price" or the lowest price possible for particular product.
If this option is disabled, your feed will only have "price" field and that field will have the lowest price possible for the particular product.
column2:
If this option is enabled, feed "price" field will be mapped to Magento "regular_price" and feed "sale_price" field will be mapped to Magento "special_price" or the lowest price possible for particular product.
If this option is disabled, your feed will only have "price" field and that field will have the lowest price possible for the particular product.

column2: Enable sale_price_effect_date Field

column1: Enables or disables sale_price_effective_date in product feed.
column2: Enables or disables sale_price_effective_date in product feed.

column1: This option is valid only if a sale_price field is enabled.
column2: This option is valid only if a sale_price field is enabled.

column1: Additional Fields to Attributes Mapping
column2: Additional Fields to Attributes Mapping

column1: If an option for certain field is not present above you can map it here. Please see a tooltip.
column2: If an option for certain field is not present above you can map it here. Please see a tooltip.

column1:
Example: color=color|pattern=pattern
As you can see the format is simple
field1=attribute1|field2=attribute2
Facebook feed field and Magento product attribute are connected by = sign and pairs are separated by | sign.
column2:
Example: color=color|pattern=pattern
As you can see the format is simple
field1=attribute1|field2=attribute2
Facebook feed field and Magento product attribute are connected by = sign and pairs are separated by | sign.

column1: Cron

column1: Facebook Catalog Product Feed Generation Cron Job
column2: Facebook Catalog Product Feed Generation Cron Job

column1: Enable Product Feed Generation Cron Job
column2: Enable Product Feed Generation Cron Job

column1: Enables or disables product feed generation cron job.
column2: Enables or disables product feed generation cron job.

column1: Cron Expression for Product Feed Generation
column2: Cron Expression for Product Feed Generation

column1: Cron expression used to trigger product feed generation process. Example: 15 2 * * * (once a day at 2:15 AM)
column2: Cron expression used to trigger product feed generation process. Example: 15 2 * * * (once a day at 2:15 AM)

column1:
Examples:
*/5 * * * * (every 5 minutes)
0,30 * * * * (twice an hour)
0 * * * * (once an hour)
0 0,12 * * * (twice a day)
0 0 * * * (once a day)
0 0 * * 0 (once a week)
0 0 1,15 * * (1st and 15th)
0 0 1 * * (once a month)
0 0 1 1 * (once a year)
column2:
Examples:
*/5 * * * * (every 5 minutes)
0,30 * * * * (twice an hour)
0 * * * * (once an hour)
0 0,12 * * * (twice a day)
0 0 * * * (once a day)
0 0 * * 0 (once a week)
0 0 1,15 * * (1st and 15th)
0 0 1 * * (once a month)
0 0 1 1 * (once a year)
